What's On

  • A Private Life

    Dir. Rebecca Zlotowski
    Constellation
    Thu 30 Oct - Fri 7 Nov
    Jodie Foster shines in her first French-speaking lead role in Rebecca Zlotowski’s playful murder mystery.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Blue Moon

    Dir. Richard Linklater
    Constellation - LIFF 2025 Opening Film
    Thu 30 Oct - 18:00
    Ethan Hawke delivers a career-best performance as legendary lyricist Lorenz Hart in Richard Linklater’s evocative and captivating chamber piece.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Sirāt

    Dir. Oliver Laxe
    Fanomenon Opening Film
    Thu 30 Oct - Fri 7 Nov
    Winner of the Cannes Jury Prize, Oliver Laxe’s Sirāt is a hallucinatory odyssey that demands to be experienced on the big screen.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • La Grazia

    Dir. Paolo Sorrentino
    Constellation
    Thu 30 Oct - Sat 15 Nov
    The great Paolo Sorrentino’s latest film reunites him with his favourite leading actor Toni Servillo (The Great Beauty, Il Divo), who gives a sublime performance as a fictional Italian president.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Bugonia

    Dir. Yorgos Lanthimos
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Thu 30 Oct - Tue 4 Nov
    The latest, much-anticipated collaboration between Yorgos Lanthimos and Emma Stone after Poor Things and Kinds of Kindness, Bugonia is a remake of cult Korean sci-fi comedy Save the Green Planet (2003).
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Little Amélie

    Dir. Maïlys Vallade, Liane-Cho Han Jin Kuang
    Constellation
    Fri 31 Oct and Sat 15 Nov
    Little Amélie a tender, poignant and visually stunning animated story about the healing power of human connection.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Dreams

    Dir. Michel Franco
    Constellation
    Fri 31 Oct - Sat 8 Nov
    Uncompromising Mexican director Michel Franco reunites with actress Jessica Chastain, whose cold precision powers an erotically charged political drama with a vicious sting in its tail.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Resurrection

    Dir. Bi Gan
    Constellation
    Fri 31 Oct and Sun 2 Nov
    A bold and hypnotic return from director Bi Gan (Long Day's Journey into Night) that affirms his status as one of cinema’s most ambitious visionaries.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Choral

    Dir. Nicholas Hytner
    Constellation
    Fri 31 Oct - 18:00
    From director Nicholas Hytner and writer Alan Bennett (who also collaborated on The History Boys and The Lady in the Van), The Choral is a rousing period comedy drama filmed in Bradford.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Macunaíma

    Dir. Joaquim Pedro de Andrade
    LIFF Spotlights - DESLOCAMENTOS: BRAZILIAN CINEMA ON THE MOVE
    Fri 31 Oct and Sat 1 Nov
    Macunaima is a vibrant and carnivalesque satirical comedy, an unusually playful highlight of Brazil’s fiercely political Cinema Novo movement and its first genuine Box Office hit.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Honey Bunch

    Dir. Madeleine Sims-Fewer, Dusty Mancinelli
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Fri 31 Oct and Sun 2 Nov
    Dark truths emerge from an experimental treatment for memory recovery in this gothic thriller.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Die, My Love

    Dir. Lynne Ramsay
    Constellation
    Fri 31 Oct - Thu 6 Nov
    Jennifer Lawrence and Robert Pattinson star in Lynne Ramsay’s striking drama about a woman’s descent into psychosis.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Iracema (New 4K Restoration)

    Dir. Jorge Bodanzky, Orlando Senna
    LIFF Spotlights - DESLOCAMENTOS: BRAZILIAN CINEMA ON THE MOVE
    Fri 31 Oct and Sun 2 Nov
    Iracema is an atmospheric Brazilian road movie and a savage critique of the political hypocrisies of its time.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Dead Lover

    Dir. Grace Glowicki
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Fri 31 Oct and Sun 2 Nov
    Shot on 16mm, this delightfully strange love story follows a lonely gravedigger who tries to resurrect the love of her life.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Holiday (4K Restoration)

    Dir. George Cukor
    LIFF Spotlights - WE GOTTA GET OUT OF THIS PLACE
    Sat 1 Nov and Sun 2 Nov
    Cary Grant and Katharine Hepburn sparkle in George Cukor’s sophisticated comedy of manners from 1938.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Space Cadet

    Dir. Kid Koala
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Sat 1 Nov - Sun 9 Nov
    Directed by Kid Koala and based on his graphic novel, Space Cadet is a heartwarming, music-filled, and dialogue-free futuristic lullaby about memories and the bonds that connect us.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Girl Who Stole Time

    Dir. Yu Ao, Zhou Tienan
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Sat 1 Nov and Sun 9 Nov
    From writer/directors Ao Yu and Tienan Zhou, the stunningly-animated The Girl Who Stole Time is a fast-paced fantasy action adventure packed with delights, surprises and twists to the end.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Roman Holiday (New 4K Restoration)

    Dir. William Wyler
    LIFF Spotlights - WE GOTTA GET OUT OF THIS PLACE
    Sat 1 Nov - Sat 8 Nov
    William Wyler’s Roman Holiday remains one of Hollywood’s most enchanting romantic comedies.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Blue Trail

    Dir. Gabriel Mascaro
    Constellation
    Sat 1 Nov - Sun 16 Nov
    Gabriel Mascaro’s The Blue Trail is an entrancing, inspiring and visually lush film odyssey and a striking critique of ageism and authoritarianism.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Redux Redux

    Dir. Kevin McManus, Matthew McManus
    Fanomenon - DAY OF THE DEAD
    Sat 1 Nov and Tue 11 Nov
    A bereaved mother journeys across universes to repeatedly kill her daughter’s killer in this lo-fi sci-fi horror.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Day of the Dead

    All-Day Horror Marathon
    Fanomenon - FANATHONS
    Sat 1 Nov - 13:15
    This year’s Day of the Dead includes two of the most acclaimed independent genre films of the year, Redux Redux and Hellcat, and UK Premieres of The Book of Sijjin and Illiyyin from Indonesia and We Bury the Dead from Australia.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • L'Atalante (New 4K Restoration)

    Dir. Jean Vigo
    LIFF Spotlights - WE GOTTA GET OUT OF THIS PLACE
    Sat 1 Nov - 13:30
    A visionary classic of French cinema, and Jean Vigo’s only feature, L’Atalante, is a luminous tale of love, desire and disillusionment.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Shepherd and the Bear

    Dir. Max Keegan
    Cinema Versa Opening Film
    Sat 1 Nov and Tue 4 Nov
    Set in the sublime mountainscapes of the French Pyrenees, the reintroduction of brown bears ignites a fierce conflict within a traditional shepherding community.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • In Symbiosis

    Dir. Helena Berndl, Francesco Maria Gallo
    Cinema Versa
    Sat 1 Nov and Mon 3 Nov
    A vital and informative new documentary which sets out to create a deeper understanding of the current state of our food system.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Summer with Monika

    Dir. Ingmar Bergman
    LIFF Spotlights - WE GOTTA GET OUT OF THIS PLACE
    Sat 1 Nov - 15:30
    A sensual yet sobering portrait of youthful rebellion and first love, Summer with Monika was Ingmar Bergman’s international breakthrough.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Book of Sijjin and Illiyyin

    Dir. Hadrah Daeng Ratu
    Fanomenon - DAY OF THE DEAD
    Sat 1 Nov - 15:30
    From two of the leading women horror filmmakers in Southeast Asia, writer Lele Laila and director Hadrah Daeng Ratu, The Book of Sijjin and Illiyyin is a visceral Indonesian tale of black magic revenge
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Dragonfly

    Dir. Paul Andrew Williams
    Constellation
    Sat 1 Nov - Mon 3 Nov
    Simmering tensions bring shocking consequences in a gripping human story filmed in West Yorkshire.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Pixote

    Dir. Hector Babenco
    LIFF Spotlights - DESLOCAMENTOS: BRAZILIAN CINEMA ON THE MOVE
    Sat 1 Nov and Sun 2 Nov
    Hector Babenco’s 1980 masterpiece is both a gripping crime drama and a devastating exposé of how political corruption and police brutality drive street kids into the São Paulo underworld.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Hellcat

    Dir. Brock Bodell
    Fanomenon - DAY OF THE DEAD
    Sat 1 Nov and Tue 11 Nov
    A woman must find a way out when she wakes up in a moving trailer in this simple but effective horror.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • We Bury the Dead

    Dir. Zak Hilditch
    Fanomenon - DAY OF THE DEAD
    Sat 1 Nov - 20:15
    An epic survival thriller about a young woman searching for her husband in the aftermath of a terrifying national disaster.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Rental Family

    Dir. Hikari
    Constellation
    Sat 1 Nov and Sun 9 Nov
    Hikari’s Rental Family is a poignant comedy drama starring Oscar-winner Brendan Fraser as an American actor in Tokyo whose life is changed when he is cast for an unusual role.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Bye Bye Brazil

    Dir. Carlos Diegues
    LIFF Spotlights - DESLOCAMENTOS: BRAZILIAN CINEMA ON THE MOVE
    Sat 1 Nov and Mon 3 Nov
    Bye Bye Brazil is a bittersweet Brazilian road movie about a rapidly modernising country leaving its traditions behind.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Our Land

    Dir. Orban Wallace
    Cinema Versa
    Sun 2 Nov and Tue 4 Nov
    Our Land interrogates the connections between land, power and a sense of belonging following the Right to Roam movement in Engand and Wales now it's gaining real traction.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Love Letters

    Dir. Alice Douard
    Constellation
    Sun 2 Nov - Sun 16 Nov
    Ella Rumpf (Julia Ducournau’s Raw) and Monia Chokri give exceptional performances in Alice Douard’s debut feature Love Letters, a tender and affecting drama inspired by the director’s own experiences of queer parenthood.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Mary Anning

    Dir. Marcel Barelli
    Constellation
    Sun 2 Nov - Sun 16 Nov
    The pioneering fossil collector’s youth is brought to life in this charming Swiss animation.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Cinema, Aspirins and Vultures (35mm)

    Dir. Marcelo Gomes
    LIFF Spotlights - DESLOCAMENTOS: BRAZILIAN CINEMA ON THE MOVE
    Sun 2 Nov - 13:30
    Far from Europe’s darkest hour at the peak of the Second World War, two men meet in the Brazilian outback in this bewitching Brazilian road movie.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Yorkshire Short Film Competition

    LIFF SHORTS
    Sun 2 Nov - Thu 13 Nov
    One of the annual highlights of the LIFF SHORTS selection, the Yorkshire Short Film Competition celebrates filmmaking from across this incredible region.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • It Was Just an Accident

    Dir. Jafar Panahi
    Constellation
    Sun 2 Nov - Sat 8 Nov
    Winner of the Palme d’Or at this year’s Cannes, Jafar Panahi’s It Was Just an Accident is a bold, darkly satirical thriller that confronts the violence of Iran’s repressive regime head-on.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Thing with Feathers

    Dir. Dylan Southern
    Constellation
    Sun 2 Nov - Wed 5 Nov
    Adapted from the novel by Max Porter and directed by Dylan Southern, The Thing with Feathers is a raw and poetic portrait of grief.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Middletown

    Dir. Amanda McBaine, Jesse Moss
    Cinema Versa
    Sun 2 Nov and Fri 14 Nov
    Idealistic teenagers really do change the world in Middletown, a fascinating documentary about a high school project that became a genuinely groundbreaking work of investigative journalism.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Rosemead

    Dir. Eric Lin
    Constellation
    Sun 2 Nov and Mon 10 Nov
    Based on a harrowing true story, Rosemead is a gripping, emotionally charged portrait of a mother’s love pushed to its limits.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • One of Us

    Dir. Marine Place
    Cinema Versa
    Sun 2 Nov and Fri 14 Nov
    Marine Place’s powerful documentary takes us to the LGBTQIA+ Centre in Lille, France where dedicated volunteers coach asylum seekers who are fleeing persecution because of their sexuality.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Sketches: Life Drawing & Jazz

    LIFF Social
    Sun 2 Nov - 19:00 - 21:00
    Free entry life drawing, accompanied by live jazz music, with a film soundtrack twist!
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Silent Friend

    Dir. Ildikó Enyedi
    Constellation
    Sun 2 Nov - Fri 14 Nov
    In Ildikó Enyedi’s mesmerising Silent Friend, three lives are quietly shaped by encounters with a majestic ginkgo biloba tree on a university campus.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Hills of Disorder

    Dir. Andrea Tonacci
    LIFF Spotlights - DESLOCAMENTOS: BRAZILIAN CINEMA ON THE MOVE
    Sun 2 Nov and Mon 3 Nov
    An unusual, immersive blend of documentary and re-enactment tells the extraordinary true story of Carapiru, an indigenous man who survived the massacre of his Amazonian tribe and wandered alone through the forests and mountains of central Brazil for a decade.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Alpha

    Dir. Julia Ducournau
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Mon 3 Nov and Sat 8 Nov
    Julia Ducournau follows her award-winning Titane with this genre-bending family drama.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Nemurubaka: Hypnic Jerks

    Dir. Yugo Sakamoto
    Fanomenon - FANORAMA
    Mon 3 Nov and Sun 9 Nov
    From director Yugo Sakamoto (Baby Assassins) and adapted from Masakazu Ishiguro’s manga, Nemurubaka: Hypnic Jerks is a comic story about the everyday life of two broke college roommates with polar opposite personalities.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Voice of Hind Rajab

    Dir. Kaouther Ben Hania
    Constellation
    Mon 3 Nov - Sun 16 Nov
    Kaouther Ben Hania’s The Voice of Hind Rajab, winner of the Grand Jury Prize at Venice Film Festival, transforms the last recorded words of a six-year-old girl in Gaza into a vital act of remembrance.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Happy Birthday

    Dir. Sarah Goher
    Constellation - CONSTELLATION FEATURE FILM COMPETITION
    Tue 4 Nov - Wed 12 Nov
    A child maid is exposed to a class system she can’t understand in this stunning Tribeca winner and Egypt’s Oscar entry.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Omaha

    Dir. Cole Webley
    Constellation - CONSTELLATION FEATURE FILM COMPETITION
    Tue 4 Nov - Sun 9 Nov
    Two young siblings are taken on a mysterious cross-country journey in this performance-driven debut starring John Magaro (First Cow, Past Lives).
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Fanomenon Short Film Competition 1

    FANOMENON
    Tue 4 Nov and Fri 7 Nov
    The very popular fantastic genre shorts selection at LIFF is now a competition, with three programmes of fantasy, horror, comedy, sci-fi and more.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Music of James Bond

    LIFF Social
    Tue 4 Nov - 20:00 - 23:00
    Step into The Domino for an evening of Bond reimagined in jazz.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • Pillion

    Dir. Harry Lighton
    Constellation
    Tue 4 Nov - Sun 16 Nov
    Harry Lighton’s bold, funny, and unexpectedly tender debut, reinvents the queer love story.
    FIND OUT MORE

  • The Mysterious Gaze of the Flamingo

    Dir. Diego Céspedes
    Constellation - CONSTELLATION FEATURE FILM COMPETITION
    Tue 4 Nov and Sat 15 Nov
    An unknown disease spreads fear through a 1980s desert town, in this Cannes Un Certain Regard winner.
    FIND OUT MORE
of 3
Next

BFI Screen Culture

Leeds Film is supported by the BFI National Lottery Audience Projects Fund which supports ambitious audience-facing independent UK and international film and broader screen activity of national scale. The fund is part of the BFI's ten-year Screen Culture 2033 strategy.

BFI Screen Culture 2033 >

Powered by Peppered

Cookies

We use cookies and similar techniques to analyze the use of the website, to make it possible to display third-party content such as videos, and for various other applications. These cookies are also placed by third parties. More information…

Functional cookies

These are necessary for the website to function properly. This way your shopping cart will be remembered and you can log in on the website with your account.

Minimal cookies

This option allows cookies to enrich your experience on the website. For example, media from third parties such as videos. We also keep statistics to continuously improve the site.

All cookies

With these cookies we collect further information to carry out our marketing activities, such as newsletters and advertisements, in the most efficient and personal way.
